title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct answer and a valid justification, based on reaction order and initial rate data, equivalent to the following.

· Agree. Comparing trials 1 and 3, when the initial pressure of F 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGgbWaaSbaaS qaaiaabkdaaeqaaaaa@3AA6@ is doubled as the initial pressure of D is held constant, the initial rate of reaction quadruples. title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct answer and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Agree. Since D is in group 16, the compound has 34 total valence electrons, which is consistent with a see-saw geometry with four bonds and one lone pair around the central atom.

The response provides both the correct answer and a valid justification equivalent to the following.
